intro: Fagara backeri, commonly known as the Sierra Leone wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Sierra Leone and parts of western Africa. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Fagara backeri typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
